programme.title: Jaguar Beach
programme.desc: On a remote stretch of Central America‚Äôs Pacific coast, the lush, volcanic landscape gives way to a startlingly different world: a dry tropical forest. Here, two creatures ‚Äî the sea turtle and the jaguar ‚Äî meet with spectacular consequences for both their species and the very different environments they inhabit, and an unwitting alliance turns the predator into the protector.

programme.title: Katavi - Africa's Fallen Paradise
programme.desc: Katavi National Park spans over 3,000 square miles of western Tanzania. Lions, hippos and crocodiles live in harmony, until an unusual climatic cycle turns the normal dry season into an extreme drought. Lion cubs face mortal danger from a rogue male lion intent on a takeover, hippos fight viciously for dwindling river territory, and even the crocodiles struggle to survive until the rains arrive.

programme.title: Katavi - Africa's Fallen Paradise
programme.desc: Katavi is in the grips of extraordinary drought. A new litter of lion cubs is born into tough conditions, vulnerable to the attack of a rogue male, intent on taking over the pride. In the crushing heat, life desperately struggles to hold out for rain.

programme.title: Katavi - Africa's Fallen Paradise
programme.desc: Katavi‚Äôs wetlands are unrecognizable in a prolonged drought, reduced to fetid, overcrowded mud wallows. At last, rains resurrect the river, inch by inch. Normality will finally return to Katavi, but amidst global climate change, for how long?.
